description.en:
Summons rain in battle for five turns.

If multiple Pokémon with this ability, drought, sand stream, or snow warning are sent out at the same time, the abilities will activate in order of Speed, respecting trick room.  Each ability's weather will cancel the previous weather, and only the weather summoned by the slowest of the Pokémon will stay.

In rain water moves have a 50% boost.
Gradually boosts SPEED. This Pokémon's Speed rises one stage after each turn.

Blocks critical hits. Moves cannot score critical hits against this Pokémon.

This ability functions identically to shell armor.
Prevents self-destruction. While this Pokémon is in battle, self destruct and explosion will fail and aftermath will not take effect.

Prevents paralysis. This Pokémon cannot be paralyzed.

If a Pokémon is paralyzed and acquires this ability, its paralysis is healed; this includes when regaining a lost ability upon leaving battle.

Ups evasion in a sandstorm. During a sandstorm, this Pokémon has 1.25× its evasion, and it does not take sandstorm damage regardless of type.

The evasion bonus does not count as a stat modifier.

Overworld: If the lead Pokémon has this ability, the wild encounter rate is halved in a sandstorm.

Restores HP if hit by a
Water-type move. Whenever a water-type move hits this Pokémon, it heals for 1/4 of its maximum HP, negating any other effect on it.

Water moves will ignore this Pokémon's substitute.

Prevents attraction. This Pokémon cannot be infatuated and is immune to captivate.

If a Pokémon is infatuated and acquires this ability, its infatuation is cleared.

Negates weather effects. While this Pokémon is in battle, weather can still be in play, but will not have any of its effects.

This ability functions identically to air lock.

Prevents sleep. This Pokémon cannot be asleep.

This causes rest to fail altogether.  If a Pokémon is asleep and acquires this ability, it will immediately wake up; this includes when regaining a lost ability upon leaving battle.

This ability functions identically to vital spirit in battle.

Prevents poisoning. This Pokémon cannot be poisoned.  This includes bad poison.

If a Pokémon is poisoned and acquires this ability, its poison is healed; this includes when regaining a lost ability upon leaving battle.

Prevents added effects. This Pokémon is immune to the extra effects of moves used against it.

An extra effect is a move's chance, listed as an "effect chance", to inflict a status ailment, cause a stat change, or make the target flinch in addition to the move's main effect.  For example, thunder shock's paralysis is an extra effect, but thunder wave's is not, nor are knock off's item removal and air cutter's increased critical hit rate.

Prevents confusion. This Pokémon cannot be confused.

If a Pokémon is confused and acquires this ability, its confusion will immediately be healed.

Gives full immunity to all
Ground-type moves. This Pokémon is immune to ground-type moves, spikes, toxic spikes, and arena trap.

This ability is disabled during gravity or ingrain, or while holding an iron ball.  This ability is not disabled during roost.

Leaves spores on contact. Whenever a move makes contact with this Pokémon, the move's user has a 30% chance of being paralyzed, poisoned, or put to sleep, chosen at random.

Nothing is done to compensate if the move's user is immune to one of these ailments; there is simply a lower chance that the move's user will be affected.

Prevents ability reduction. This Pokémon cannot have its stats lowered by other Pokémon.

This ability does not prevent any stat losses other than stat modifiers, such as the Speed cut from paralysis.  This Pokémon can still be passed negative stat modifiers through guard swap, heart swap, or power swap.

This ability functions identically to white smoke in battle.

Heals upon switching out. This Pokémon is cured of any major status ailment when it is switched out for another Pokémon.

If this ability is acquired during battle, the Pokémon is cured upon leaving battle before losing the temporary ability.

Promotes added effects. This Pokémon's moves have twice their usual effect chance.

An effect chance is a move's chance to inflict a status ailment, cause a stat change, or make the target flinch in addition to the move's main effect.  For example, flamethrower's chance of burning the target is doubled, but protect's chance of success and air cutter's increased critical hit rate are unaffected.

secret power is unaffected.

Raises SPEED in rain. This Pokémon's Speed is doubled during rain.

This bonus does not count as a stat modifier.

Raises SPEED in sunshine. This Pokémon's Speed is doubled during strong sunlight.

This bonus does not count as a stat modifier.

Encounter rate increases. Overworld: If the lead Pokémon has this ability, the wild encounter rate is doubled.

This ability has no effect in battle.

Raises ATTACK. This Pokémon's Attack is doubled while in battle.

This bonus does not count as a stat modifier.

This ability functions identically to pure power.
Poisons foe on contact. Whenever a move makes contact with this Pokémon, the move's user has a 30% chance of being poisoned.
Prevents flinching. This Pokémon cannot flinch.

Prevents burns. This Pokémon cannot be burned.

If a Pokémon is burned and acquires this ability, its burn is healed; this includes when regaining a lost ability upon leaving battle.
Slight HP recovery in rain. This Pokémon heals for 1/16 of its maximum HP after each turn during rain.

Summons a sandstorm for five turns. If multiple Pokémon with this ability, drizzle, drought, or snow warning are sent out at the same time, the abilities will activate in order of Speed, respecting trick room.  Each ability's weather will cancel the previous weather, and only the weather summoned by the slowest of the Pokémon will stay.

Overworld: If the lead Pokémon has this ability, the wild encounter rate is halved in a sandstorm.

In sand rock pokemon gain a 50% special defense boost.

Sand storm causes small damage every turn.

Rock, ground and steel Pokémon are inmune to damage caused by sand storm.
Heat-and-cold protection. This Pokémon takes half as much damage from fire- and ice-type moves.

Awakens quickly from sleep. This Pokémon's remaining sleep turn count falls by 2 rather than 1.

If this Pokémon's sleep counter is at 1, it will fall to 0 and then the Pokémon will wake up.
Makes escaping easier. This Pokémon is always successful fleeing from wild battles, even if trapped by a move or ability.

Moves only every two turns. Every second turn on which this Pokémon should attempt to use a move, it will instead do nothing ("loaf around").

Loafing around interrupts moves that take multiple turns the same way paralysis, flinching, etc do.  Most such moves, for example bide or rollout, are simply cut off upon loafing around.  Attacks with a recharge turn, such as hyper beam, do not have to recharge; attacks with a preparation turn, such as fly, do not end up being used.  Moves that are forced over multiple turns and keep going through failure, such as outrage, uproar, or any move forced by encore, keep going as usual.

If this Pokémon is confused, its confusion is not checked when loafing around; the Pokémon cannot hurt itself, and its confusion does not end or come closer to ending.

If this Pokémon attempts to move but fails, e.g. because of paralysis or gravity, it still counts as having moved and will loaf around the next turn.  If it does not attempt to move, e.g. because it is asleep or frozen, whatever it would have done will be postponed until its next attempt; that is, it will either loaf around or move as usual, depending on what it last did.

This ability cannot be changed with worry seed, but it can be disabled with gastro acid, changed with role play, or traded away with skill swap.

Changes with the weather. During rain, strong sunlight, or hail, this Pokémon's type changes to water, fire, or ice, respectively, and its form changes to match.

This ability has no effect for any Pokémon other than castform.

If the weather ends or becomes anything that does not trigger this ability, or a Pokémon with air lock or cloud nine enters battle, this Pokémon's type and form revert to their default.  If this ability is lost or disabled, this Pokémon cannot change its current type and form until it regains its ability.

Ups DEFENSE if suffering. Whenever this Pokémon has a major status ailment, it has 1.5× its Defense.

This bonus does not count as a stat modifier.

Draining causes injury. Whenever a Pokémon would heal after hitting this Pokémon with a leeching move like absorb, it instead loses as many HP as it would usually gain.

dream eater is unaffected.

Powers up Grass-type
moves in a pinch. When this Pokémon has 1/3 or less of its HP remaining, its grass-type moves inflict 1.5× as much regular damage.
Ups FIRE moves in a pinch. When this Pokémon has 1/3 or less of its HP remaining, its fire-type moves inflict 1.5× as much regular damage.
Ups WATER moves in a pinch. When this Pokémon has 1/3 or less of its HP remaining, its water-type moves inflict 1.5× as much regular damage.

Protects the Pokémon from recoil damage. This Pokémon does not receive recoil damage from its recoil moves.

struggle's recoil is unaffected.  This ability does not prevent crash damage from missing with jump kick or high jump kick.

Summons sunlight in battle for five turns. If multiple Pokémon with this ability, drizzle, sand stream, or snow warning are sent out at the same time, the abilities will activate in order of Speed, respecting trick room.  Each ability's weather will cancel the previous weather, and only the weather summoned by the slowest of the Pokémon will stay.

Fire moves gain a 50% boots.

Raises ATTACK. This Pokémon's Attack is doubled in battle.

This bonus does not count as a stat modifier.

This ability functions identically to huge power.

Blocks critical hits. Moves cannot score critical hits against this Pokémon.

This ability functions identically to battle armor.

Negates weather effects. While this Pokémon is in battle, weather can still be in play, but will not have any of its effects.

This ability functions identically to cloud nine.

Raises evasion if the
Pokémon is confused. When this Pokémon is confused, it has twice its evasion.

Raises Speed if hit by an
Electric-type move. Whenever an electric-type move hits this Pokémon, its Speed rises one stage, negating any other effect on it.

This ability will not take effect if this Pokémon is immune to Electric moves.  Electric moves will ignore this Pokémon's substitute.

This effect includes non-damaging moves, i.e. thunder wave.

Raises Attack if the foe
is of the same gender. This Pokémon inflicts 1.25× as much regular damage against Pokémon of the same gender and 0.75× as much regular damage against Pokémon of the opposite gender.

If either Pokémon is genderless, damage is unaffected.

Raises Speed each time
the Pokémon flinches. Whenever this Pokémon flinches, its Speed rises one stage.

Raises evasion in a
hailstorm. During hail, this Pokémon has 1.25× its evasion, and it does not take hail damage regardless of type.

The evasion bonus does not count as a stat modifier.

Overworld: If the lead Pokémon has this ability, the wild encounter rate is halved in snow.

Encourages the early use
of a held Berry. This Pokémon eats any held Berry triggered by low HP when it falls below 50% of its HP, regardless of the Berry's usual threshold.

Raises Attack upon taking
a critical hit. Whenever this Pokémon receives a critical hit, its Attack rises to the maximum of 6 stages.

This ability will still take effect if the critical hit is received by a substitute.

Raises Speed if a held
item is used. When this Pokémon uses or loses its held item, its Speed is doubled.  If it gains another item or leaves battle, this bonus is lost.

This includes when the Pokémon drops its item because of knock off.  This bonus does not count as a stat modifier.  There is no notification when this ability takes effect.

Weakens the power of
Fire-type moves. This Pokémon takes half as much damage from fire-type moves and burns.

The Pokémon is prone to
wild stat changes. Each stage of this Pokémon's stat modifiers acts as two stages.  These doubled stages are still limited to a minimum of -6 and a maximum of 6.

This Pokémon can still accumulate less than -3 or more than 3 stages of stat modifiers, even though the extra ones have no effect after doubling.

Reduces HP if it is hot.
Water restores HP. This Pokémon takes 1/8 of its maximum HP in damage after each turn during strong sunlight, but it heals for 1/8 of its HP each turn during rain.  This Pokémon takes 1.25× as much damage from fire-type moves, but whenever a water move hits it, it heals for 1/4 its maximum HP instead.

Adjusts power according
to the foe’s ability. When this Pokémon enters battle, its Attack or Special Attack, whichever corresponds to its opponents' weaker total defensive stat, rises one stage.  In the event of a tie, Special Attack is raised.

This ability also takes effect when acquired during a battle.

Boosts the power of
punching moves. Moves flagged as being punch-based have 1.2× their base power for this Pokémon.

sucker punch is not flagged as punch-based; its original, Japanese name only means "surprise attack".

Powers up moves of the
same type. This Pokémon inflicts twice as much damage with moves whose types match its own, rather than the usual same-type attack bonus of 1.5×.

Heals status problems if
it is raining. This Pokémon is cured of any major status ailment after each turn during rain.

Boosts Sp. Atk, but
lowers HP in sunshine. During strong sunlight, this Pokémon has 1.5× its Special Attack but takes 1/8 of its maximum HP in damage after each turn.

Boosts Speed if there is a
status problem. Whenever this Pokémon has a major status ailment, it has 1.5× its Speed.  This Pokémon is not affected by the usual Speed cut from paralysis.

Overworld: If the lead Pokémon has this ability, the wild encounter rate is halved.

All the Pokémon’s moves
become the Normal type. This Pokémon's moves all act as if they were normal-type.

Moves that inflict typeless damage do so as usual.  Moves of variable type, such as hidden power, are affected.  They otherwise work as usual, however; weather ball, for example, is always forced to be Normal, but it still has doubled power and looks different during weather.

As thunder wave is prevented by immunities, unlike most non-damaging moves, it does not affect ghost-type Pokémon under the effect of this ability.

Powers up moves if they
become critical hits. This Pokémon inflicts triple damage with critical hits, rather than the usual double damage.

The Pokémon moves after
even slower foes. This Pokémon moves last within its priority bracket.

Multiple Pokémon with this ability move in order of Speed amongst themselves.

The full incense and lagging tail take precedence over this ability; that is, Pokémon with these items move after Pokémon with this ability.  Pokémon with both this ability and one of these items are delayed as much as if they had only the item.

This ability works as usual during trick room: Pokémon with this ability will move in reverse order of Speed after Pokémon without it.

Moves can be used
regardless of abilities. This Pokémon's moves completely ignore abilities that could hinder or prevent their effect on the target.

For example, this Pokémon's moves ignore abilities that would fully negate them, such as water absorb; abilities that would prevent any of their effects, such as clear body, shell armor, or sticky hold; and abilities that grant any general protective benefit, such as simple, snow cloak, or thick fat.  If an ability could either hinder or help this Pokémon's moves, e.g. dry skin or unaware, the ability is ignored either way.

Abilities that do not fit this description, even if they could hinder moves in some other way, are not affected.  For example, cursed body only affects potential future uses of the move, while liquid ooze and shadow tag can only hinder a move's effect on the user.  This ablity cannot ignore type or form changes granted by abilities, for example color change or forecast; nor effects that were caused by abilities but are no longer tied to an ability, such as the rain from drizzle.  This ability cannot ignore multitype at all.

An ability ignored by this ability is only nullified while the move is being used.  For example, this Pokémon's moves can paralyze a Pokémon with limber, but Limber will activate and heal the paralysis immediately thereafter, and this Pokémon's spikes are not affected by this ability after they have been placed.

When this Pokémon enters battle, all participating trainers are notified that it has this ability.

This ability functions identically to teravolt and turboblaze.

Heightens the critical-hit
ratios of moves. This Pokémon's moves have critical hit rates one stage higher than normal.

Damages the foe landing
the finishing hit. When this Pokémon is knocked out by a move that makes contact, the move's user takes 1/4 its maximum HP in damage.

Senses the foe’s
dangerous moves. When this Pokémon enters battle, if one of its opponents has a move that is super effective against it, self destruct, explosion, or a one-hit knockout move, all participating trainers are notified.

The move itself is not revealed; only that there is such a move.  Moves that inflict typeless damage, such as future sight, and moves of variable type, such as hidden power, count as their listed types.  counter, metal burst, mirror coat, and one-hit KO moves to which this Pokémon is immune do not trigger this ability.

Determines what moves
the foe has. When this Pokémon enters battle, it reveals the move with the highest base power known by any opposing Pokémon to all participating trainers.

In the event of a tie, one is chosen at random.

Moves without a listed base power are assigned one as follows:

Power | Moves
----: | -----
  160 | One-hit KO moves: fissure, guillotine, horn drill, and sheer cold
  120 | Counter moves: counter, metal burst, and mirror coat
   80 | Variable power or set damage: crush grip, dragon rage, electro ball, endeavor, final gambit, flail, frustration, grass knot, gyro ball, heat crash, heavy slam, hidden power, low kick, natural gift, night shade, psywave, return, reversal, seismic toss, sonic boom, trump card, and wring out
    0 | Any such move not listed

Ignores any change in
ability by the foe. This Pokémon ignores other Pokémon's stat modifiers for the purposes of damage and accuracy calculation.

Effectively, this affects modifiers of every stat except Speed.

The power of punishment and stored power is calculated as usual.  When this Pokémon hurts itself in confusion, its stat modifiers affect damage as usual.

Powers up “not very
effective” moves. This Pokémon deals twice as much damage with moves that are not very effective against the target.

Powers down super­
effective moves. This Pokémon takes 0.75× as much damage from moves that are super effective against it.

This ability functions identically to solid rock.

Temporarily halves Attack
and Speed. This Pokémon's Attack and Speed are halved for five turns upon entering battle.

This ability also takes effect when acquired during battle.  If this Pokémon loses its ability before the five turns are up, its Attack and Speed return to normal; if it then regains this ability without leaving battle, its Attack and Speed are halved again, but the counter keeps counting from where it was.

Enables moves to hit
Ghost-type foes. This Pokémon ignores ghost-type Pokémon's immunity to normal- and fighting-type moves.

Ghost Pokémon's other types affect damage as usual.

The Pokémon regains HP in
a hailstorm. This Pokémon heals for 1/16 of its maximum HP after each turn during hail, and it does not take hail damage regardless of type.

Powers down super­
effective moves. This Pokémon takes 0.75× as much damage from moves that are super effective against it.

This ability functions identically to filter.

The Pokémon summons a
hailstorm in battle. The weather changes to hail when this Pokémon enters battle and does not end unless cancelled by another weather condition.

If multiple Pokémon with this ability, drizzle, drought, or sand stream are sent out at the same time, the abilities will activate in order of Speed, respecting trick room.  Each ability's weather will cancel the previous weather, and only the weather summoned by the slowest of the Pokémon will stay.

In hailstorm Ice Pokémon has a 50% defense boost.

The Pokémon may gather
Honey from somewhere. This Pokémon has a chance of picking up honey after each battle.  This chance starts at 5% and rises another 5% after every tenth level: 5% from level 1–10, 10% from 11–20, and so on, up to 50% from 91–100.

This ability is checked after the battle ends, at which point any temporary ability changes have worn off.

The Pokémon can check
the foe’s held item. When this Pokémon enters battle, it reveals an opposing Pokémon's held item to all participating trainers.

In a double battle, if one opponent has an item, this Pokémon will Frisk that Pokémon; if both have an item, it will Frisk one at random.

Powers up moves that
have recoil damage. This Pokémon's recoil moves and crash moves have 1.2× their base power.

struggle is unaffected.

The "crash moves" are the moves that damage the user upon missing: jump kick and high jump kick.

Changes type to match
the held Plate. If this Pokémon is holding an elemental Plate, its type and form change to match the Plate.

This Pokémon's held item, whether or not it is a Plate, cannot be taken by covet or thief, nor removed by knock off, nor traded by switcheroo or trick.  Covet, Thief, and Knock Off still inflict damage against this Pokémon.  Unlike with sticky hold, this Pokémon cannot use fling, Switcheroo, or Trick to lose its item itself, nor gain an item through Switcheroo or Trick if it does not have one.

This ability has no effect for any Pokémon other than arceus.  This ability cannot be traded with skill swap, nor copied with role play or trace, nor disabled with gastro acid, nor changed with worry seed.  This Pokémon cannot use Skill Swap or Role Play to lose its ability itself.  mold breaker cannot ignore this ability.

If a Pokémon Transforms into an Arceus with this ability, it will Transform into Arceus's default, normal-type form.  If the Transforming Pokémon is holding a Plate, this ability will then activate and change the Pokémon into the corresponding form.

Powers up party Pokémon
when it is sunny. Friendly Pokémon have 1.5× their Attack and Special Defense during strong sunlight if any friendly Pokémon has this ability.

Unlike forecast, multitype, and zen mode, this ability is not tied to its Pokémon's form change; cherrim will switch between its forms even if it loses this ability.  As such, this ability also works if obtained by a Pokémon other than Cherrim.

Reduces a sleeping foe’s
HP. Opposing Pokémon take 1/8 of their maximum HP in damage after each turn while they are asleep.

Steals an item when hit
by another Pokémon. Whenever a move makes contact with this Pokémon, if it does not have a held item, it steals the attacker's held item.

This Pokémon cannot steal upon being knocked out.  It can steal if the attacker has a substitute, but cannot steal when its own Substitute is hit.  If a move hits multiple times, only the last hit triggers this ability.  If this Pokémon is wild, it cannot steal from a trained Pokémon.

Removes added effects to
increase move damage. This Pokémon's moves with extra effects have 1.3× their power, but lose their extra effects.

An effect chance is a move's chance to inflict a status ailment, cause a stat change, or make the target flinch in addition to the move's main effect. For example, thunder shock's paralysis is an extra effect, but thunder wave's is not, nor are knock off's item removal and air cutter's increased critical hit rate.

Moves that lower the user's stats are unaffected.

Makes stat changes have
an opposite effect. Whenever this Pokémon's stats would be raised, they are instead lowered by the same amount, and vice versa.

Makes the foe nervous and
unable to eat Berries. Opposing Pokémon cannot eat held Berries while this Pokémon is in battle.

Affected Pokémon can still use bug bite or pluck to eat a target's Berry.

When its stats are lowered
its Attack increases. When any of this Pokémon's stats are lowered, its Attack rises by two stages.

If multiple stats are lowered at once, this ability takes effect with each stat lowered.

Lowers stats when HP
becomes half or less. This Pokémon's Attack and Special Attack are halved when it has half its HP or less.

May disable a move used
on the Pokémon. Moves that hit this Pokémon have a 30% chance of being Disabled afterward.

May heal an ally’s status
conditions. Friendly Pokémon next to this Pokémon in double and triple battles each have a 30% chance of being cured of any major status ailment after each turn.

Reduces damage done
to allies. All friendly Pokémon take 0.75× as much direct damage from moves while this Pokémon is in battle.

This effect stacks if multiple allied Pokémon have it.

Physical attacks lower
Defense and raise Speed. Whenever a physical move hits this Pokémon, its Speed rises one stage and its Defense falls one stage.

This ability triggers on every hit of a multiple-hit move.

Doubles the Pokémon’s
weight. This Pokémon has double the usual weight for its species.

Halves the Pokémon’s
weight. This Pokémon has half the usual weight for its species.

Reduces damage when HP
is full. This Pokémon takes half as much damage when it is hit having full HP.

Powers up physical
attacks when poisoned. This Pokémon has 1.5× its Attack when poisoned.

Powers up special attacks
when burned. This Pokémon has 1.5× its Special Attack when burned.

May create another
Berry after one is used. After each turn, if the last item this Pokémon consumed was a Berry and it is not currently holding an item, it has a 50% chance of regaining that Berry, or a 100% chance during strong sunlight.

Anticipates an ally’s
attack and dodges it. This Pokémon does not take damage from friendly Pokémon's moves, including single-target moves aimed at it.

Raises one stat and
lowers another. After each turn, one of this Pokémon's stats at random rises two stages, and another falls one stage.

If a stat is already at 6 or -6 stages, it will not be chosen to be increased or decreased, respectively.

Protects the Pokémon from
damage from weather. This Pokémon does not take damage from weather.

May poison targets when a
Pokémon makes contact. This Pokémon's contact moves have a 30% chance of poisoning the target with each hit.

This counts as an extra effect for the purposes of shield dust.  This ability takes effect before mummy.

Restores a little HP when
withdrawn from battle. This Pokémon regains 1/3 of its maximum HP when it is switched out for another Pokémon under any circumstances other than having fainted.

This ability does not take effect when a battle ends.

Protects the Pokémon from
Defense-lowering attacks. This Pokémon's Defense cannot be lowered by other Pokémon.

This Pokémon can still be passed negative Defense modifiers through heart swap or guard swap.

Boosts the Pokémon’s
Speed in a sandstorm. This Pokémon's Speed is doubled during a sandstorm, and it does not take sandstorm damage, regardless of type.

Makes status-changing
moves more likely to miss. Non-damaging moves have exactly 50% base accuracy against this Pokémon.

Boosts move power when
the Pokémon moves last. This Pokémon's moves have 1.3× their power when it moves last in a turn.

future sight and doom desire are unaffected.

Comes out disguised as
the Pokémon in back. This Pokémon, upon being sent out, appears to have the species, nickname, and Poké Ball of the last Pokémon in the party that is able to battle.  This illusion breaks upon being hit by a damaging move.

Other damage, e.g. from weather or spikes, does not break the illusion, nor does damage done to a substitute.

If the party order becomes temporarily shuffled around as Pokémon are switched out in battle, this ability chooses the last Pokémon according to that shuffled order.

It transforms itself into
the Pokémon it is facing. This Pokémon transforms into a random opponent upon entering battle.  This effect is identical to the move transform.

Passes through the foe’s
barrier and strikes. This Pokémon's moves ignore light screen, reflect, and safeguard.

Contact with this Pokémon
spreads this Ability. Whenever a contact move hits this Pokémon, the attacking Pokémon's ability changes to Mummy.

multitype is unaffected.  If a Pokémon with moxie knocks this Pokémon out, the former's ability will change without taking effect.

Boosts Attack after
knocking out any Pokémon. This Pokémon's Attack rises one stage upon knocking out another Pokémon, even a friendly Pokémon.

This ability does not take effect when the Pokémon indirectly causes another Pokémon to faint, e.g. through poison or spikes.

If this Pokémon knocks out a Pokémon with mummy, the former's ability will change without taking effect.

Raises Attack when hit by
a Dark-type move. Whenever a dark-type move hits this Pokémon, its Attack rises one stage.

The move is not negated in any way.

Some move types scare
it and boost its Speed. This Pokémon's Speed rises one stage with each hit from a damaging dark-, ghost-, or bug-type move.

Reflects status-
changing moves. When this Pokémon is targeted by a move flagged as being reflectable, the move is redirected to its user.

All reflectable moves are non-damaging, and most non-damaging moves that target other Pokémon are reflectable.

A move reflected by this ability or magic coat cannot be reflected back.

Boosts Attack when hit by
a Grass-type move. Whenever a grass-type move hits this Pokémon, its Attack rises one stage, negating any other effect on it.

Gives priority to a
status move. This Pokémon's non-damaging moves have their priority increased by one stage.

Boosts certain moves’
power in a sandstorm. During a sandstorm, this Pokémon's rock-, ground-, and steel-type moves have 1.3× their base power.  This Pokémon does not take sandstorm damage, regardless of type.

Inflicts damage to the
Pokémon on contact. Whenever a move makes contact with this Pokémon, the move's user takes 1/8 of its maximum HP in damage.

This ability functions identically to rough skin.

Changes the Pokémon’s
shape when HP is halved. This Pokémon switches between Standard Mode and Zen Mode after each turn depending on its HP.  Below 50% of its maximum HP, it switches to Zen Mode, and at 50% or above, it switches to Standard Mode.

This Pokémon returns to Standard Mode upon leaving battle or losing this ability.  This ability has no effect if this Pokémon is not a darmanitan.

Boosts the accuracy of its
allies and itself. All friendly Pokémon's moves, including this Pokémon's own moves, have 1.1× their usual accuracy while this Pokémon is in battle.

Moves can be used
regardless of Abilities. This Pokémon's moves completely ignore abilities that could hinder or prevent their effect on the target.

For example, this Pokémon's moves ignore abilities that would fully negate them, such as water absorb; abilities that would prevent any of their effects, such as clear body, shell armor, or sticky hold; and abilities that grant any general protective benefit, such as simple, snow cloak, or thick fat.  If an ability could either hinder or help this Pokémon's moves, e.g. dry skin or unaware, the ability is ignored either way.

Abilities that do not fit this description, even if they could hinder moves in some other way, are not affected.  For example, cursed body only affects potential future uses of the move, while liquid ooze and shadow tag can only hinder a move's effect on the user.  This ablity cannot ignore type or form changes granted by abilities, for example color change or forecast; nor effects that were caused by abilities but are no longer tied to an ability, such as the rain from drizzle.  This ability cannot ignore multitype at all.

An ability ignored by this ability is only nullified while the move is being used.  For example, this Pokémon's moves can paralyze a Pokémon with limber, but Limber will activate and heal the paralysis immediately thereafter, and this Pokémon's spikes are not affected by this ability after they have been placed.

When this Pokémon enters battle, all participating trainers are notified that it has this ability.

This ability functions identically to mold breaker and teravolt.

Moves can be used
regardless of Abilities. This Pokémon's moves completely ignore abilities that could hinder or prevent their effect on the target.

For example, this Pokémon's moves ignore abilities that would fully negate them, such as water absorb; abilities that would prevent any of their effects, such as clear body, shell armor, or sticky hold; and abilities that grant any general protective benefit, such as simple, snow cloak, or thick fat.  If an ability could either hinder or help this Pokémon's moves, e.g. dry skin or unaware, the ability is ignored either way.

Abilities that do not fit this description, even if they could hinder moves in some other way, are not affected.  For example, cursed body only affects potential future uses of the move, while liquid ooze and shadow tag can only hinder a move's effect on the user.  This ablity cannot ignore type or form changes granted by abilities, for example color change or forecast; nor effects that were caused by abilities but are no longer tied to an ability, such as the rain from drizzle.  This ability cannot ignore multitype at all.

An ability ignored by this ability is only nullified while the move is being used.  For example, this Pokémon's moves can paralyze a Pokémon with limber, but Limber will activate and heal the paralysis immediately thereafter, and this Pokémon's spikes are not affected by this ability after they have been placed.

When this Pokémon enters battle, all participating trainers are notified that it has this ability.

This ability functions identically to mold breaker and turboblaze.

Protects allies from attacks that
limit their move choices. Protects allies against moves that affect their mental state.

Prevents lowering of ally
Grass-type Pokémon’s stats. Protects friendly grass Pokémon from having their stats lowered by other Pokémon.

Restores HP as well when
the Pokémon eats a Berry. Restores HP upon eating a Berry, in addition to the Berry's effect.

Changes the Pokémon’s type to
the type of the move it’s using. Changes the bearer's type to match each move it uses.

The type change takes place just before the move is used.

Halves damage from
physical moves. Halves damage from physical attacks.

The Pokémon steals the held item
of a Pokémon it hits with a move. Steals the target's held item when the bearer uses a damaging move.

Protects the Pokémon from
some ball and bomb moves. Protects against bullet, ball, and bomb-based moves.

Boosts the Sp. Atk stat when
a stat is lowered. Raises Special Attack by two stages upon having any stat lowered.

The Pokémon’s strong jaw gives
it tremendous biting power. Strengthens biting moves to 1.5× their power.

Normal-type moves become
Ice-type moves. Turns the bearer's normal-type moves into ice-type moves.  Moves changed by this ability have 1.3× their power.

Prevents itself and ally Pokémon
from falling asleep. Prevents friendly Pokémon from sleeping.

The Pokémon changes form
depending on how it battles. Changes aegislash to Blade Forme before using a damaging move, or Shield Forme before using kings shield.

Gives priority to Flying-type
moves. Raises flying moves' priority by one stage.
Powers up aura and pulse moves. Strengthens aura and pulse moves to 1.5× their power.

Boosts the Defense stat
in Grassy Terrain. Boosts Defense while grassy terrain is in effect.

The Pokémon can pass
an item to an ally. Passes the bearer's held item to an ally when the ally uses up its item.

Powers up moves that
make direct contact. Strengthens moves that make contact to 1.33× their power.

Normal-type moves become
Fairy-type moves. Turns the bearer's normal-type moves into fairy moves.  Moves changed by this ability have 1.3× their power.

Contact with the Pokémon
lowers the attacker’s Speed stat. Lowers attacking Pokémon's Speed by one stage on contact.

Normal-type moves become
Flying-type moves. Turns the bearer's normal-type moves into flying-type moves.  Moves changed by this ability have 1.3× their power.

Parent and child
attack together. Lets the bearer hit twice with damaging moves.  The second hit has half power.

Powers up each Pokémon’s
Dark-type moves. Strengthens dark moves for all friendly and opposing Pokémon.

Powers up each Pokémon’s
Fairy-type moves. Strengthens fairy moves for all friendly and opposing Pokémon.

The effects of “Aura” Abilities
are reversed. While this Pokémon is on the field, dark aura and fairy aura weaken moves of their respective types to 2/3 their power, rather than strengthening them.

Affects weather and nullifies any
Fire-type attacks. When this Pokémon enters battle or gains this ability, the weather becomes heavy rain.  Heavy rain has all the properties of rain dance and also causes damaging Fire moves to fail.

Heavy rain ends when this Pokémon leaves battle or loses this ability, or when this ability is nullified.  The weather cannot otherwise be changed except by the effects of delta stream and desolate land.

air lock and cloud nine will prevent the effects of heavy rain, including allowing Fire moves to work, but will not allow the weather to be changed.

Affects weather and nullifies any
Water-type attacks. When this Pokémon enters battle or gains this ability, the weather becomes extremely harsh sunlight.  Extremely harsh sunlight has all the properties of sunny day and also causes damaging Water moves to fail.

Extremely harsh sunlight ends when this Pokémon leaves battle or loses this ability, or when this ability is nullified.  The weather cannot otherwise be changed except by the effects of delta stream and primordial sea.

air lock and cloud nine will prevent the effects of extremely harsh sunlight, including allowing Water moves to work, but will not allow the weather to be changed.

Affects weather and eliminates all
of the Flying type’s weaknesses. When this Pokémon enters battle or gains this ability, the weather becomes a mysterious air current.  A mysterious air current causes moves to not be super effective against Flying; they do neutral damage instead.  anticipation and stealth rock are not affected.

The mysterious air current ends when this Pokémon leaves battle or loses this ability, or when this ability is nullified.  The weather cannot otherwise be changed except by the effects of desolate land and primordial sea.

air lock and cloud nine will prevent the effect of a mysterious air current, but will not allow the weather to be changed.
Boosts the Defense stat when hit by an attack. Raises this Pokémon's Defense by one stage when it takes damage from a move.

The Pokémon cowardly switches out when its HP
becomes half or less. After this Pokémon is hit by a move, if that move caused this Pokémon's HP to drop below half, it switches out.

The Pokémon, sensing danger, switches out when its
HP becomes half or less. After this Pokémon is hit by a move, if that move caused this Pokémon's HP to drop below half, it switches out.

Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat sharply when hit
by a Water-type move. Raises this Pokémon's Defense by two stages when it's hit by a Water move.

The Pokémon’s attacks become critical hits if the
target is poisoned. This Pokémon's moves critical hit against poisoned targets.

When its HP becomes half or less, the Pokémon’s
shell breaks and it becomes aggressive. When this Pokémon enters battle and at the end of each turn, if its HP is 50% or above, it changes into Meteor Form; otherwise, it changes into Core Form.  In Meteor Form, it cannot be given a major status ailment (though existing ones are not cured), cannot become drowsy from yawn, and cannot use rest (which will simply fail).

This ability cannot be copied, replaced, or nullified.  This ability only takes effect for Minior.

Doubles the damage dealt to the target’s
replacement if the target switches out. This Pokémon's moves have double power against Pokémon that switched in this turn.

Lowers the power of Fire-type moves done to the
Pokémon and prevents the Pokémon from getting
a burn. When this Pokémon is hit by a Fire move, the damage is halved.  When this Pokémon uses a Water move, the power is doubled. This Pokémon cannot be burned, and if it becomes burned, the burn is immediately cured.
Powers up Steel-type moves. This Pokémon's Steel moves have 1.5× power.

Boosts the Pokémon’s Sp. Atk stat when it takes a 
hit that causes its HP to become half or less. Whenever this Pokémon takes damage from a move that causes its HP to drop below 50%, its Special Attack rises by one stage.
Boosts the Pokémon’s Speed stat in a hailstorm. During Hail, this Pokémon has double Speed.

The Pokémon uses its moves without making contact
with the target. A move used by this Pokémon will not make contact.
All sound-based moves become Water-type moves. When this Pokémon uses a move that is sound-based, that move's type is Water.
Gives priority to a healing move. This Pokémon's healing moves have their priority increased by 3.

Normal-type moves become Electric-type moves.
The power of those moves is boosted a little. When this Pokémon uses a Normal moves, that move is Electric its power is 1.2×.

Doubles the Pokémon’s Speed stat on
Electric Terrain. Doubles this Pokémon's Speed on Electric Terrain.

When it has a lot of HP, the Pokémon forms a
powerful school. It stops schooling when its HP
is low. If this Pokémon is a wishiwashi and level 20 or above, then when it enters battle and at the start of each turn, it becomes Schooling Form if its HP is 25% or higher and Solo Form otherwise.

This ability cannot be replaced, copied, or nullified.

Once per battle, the shroud that covers the
Pokémon can protect it from an attack. If this Pokémon is in its Disguised Form and takes damage from a move, it switches to its Busted Form and the damage is prevented.  Other effects are not prevented.

This ability cannot be copied or replaced.  This ability only takes effect for Mimikyu.

Defeating an opposing Pokémon strengthens the
Pokémon’s bond with its Trainer, and it becomes
Ash-Greninja. Water Shuriken gets more powerful. Transforms this Pokémon into Ash-Greninja after fainting an opponent.  Water Shuriken's power is 20 and always hits three times.

This ability cannot be copied or replaced.  This ability only takes effect for Greninja.

Other Cells gather to aid when its HP becomes
half or less. Then the Pokémon changes
its form to Complete Forme. Transforms 10% or 50% Zygarde into Complete Forme when its HP is below 50%.

This ability cannot be copied or replaced.  This ability only takes effect for Zygarde.

The Pokémon can poison the target even if it’s
a Steel or Poison type. This Pokémon's moves and item ignore the usual immunity of Poison and Steel Pokémon when attempting to inflict poison.

It’s always drowsing and will never wake up.
It can attack without waking up. This Pokémon always acts as though it were Asleep.  It cannot be given another status ailment; it's unaffected by yawn; it can use sleep talk; and so on.

Its majesty pressures the opposing Pokémon,
making it unable to attack using priority moves. When an opposing Pokémon attempts to use a move that targets this Pokémon or an ally, and that move has priority, it will fail.

Damages the attacker landing the finishing hit
by the amount equal to its last HP. When this Pokémon faints from an opponent's move, that opponent takes damage equal to the HP this Pokémon had remaining.

When another Pokémon uses a dance move,
it can use a dance move following it regardless
of its Speed. Whenever another Pokémon uses a dance move, this Pokémon will use the same move immediately afterwards.
Powers up ally Pokémon’s special moves. Ally Pokémon's moves have their power increased to 1.3×.

Halves the damage taken from moves that make
direct contact, but doubles that of Fire-type moves. Damage from contact moves is halved.  Damage from Fire moves is doubled.

Surprises the opposing Pokémon, making it unable
to attack using priority moves. When an opposing Pokémon attempts to use a move that targets this Pokémon or an ally, and that move has priority, it will fail.
Boosts its Sp. Atk stat every time a Pokémon faints. This Pokémon's Special Attack rises by one stage every time any Pokémon faints.

Contact with the Pokémon lowers the attacker’s
Speed stat. When this Pokémon takes regular damage from a contact move, the attacking Pokémon's Speed lowers by one stage.
The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally. When an ally faints, this Pokémon gains its Ability.
The Pokémon copies the Ability of a defeated ally. When an ally faints, this Pokémon gains its Ability.

The Pokémon boosts its most proficient stat each
time it knocks out a Pokémon. Raises this Pokémon's highest stat by one stage when it faints another Pokémon.

Changes the Pokémon’s type to match the
memory disc it holds. Changes this Pokémon's type to match its held Memory.

This ability cannot be copied, replaced, or nullified.  This ability only takes effect for Silvally.

Turns the ground into Electric Terrain when the
Pokémon enters a battle. When this Pokémon enters battle, it changes the terrain to electric terrain.

Turns the ground into Psychic Terrain when
the Pokémon enters a battle. When this Pokémon enters battle, it changes the terrain to psychic terrain.

Turns the ground into Misty Terrain when
the Pokémon enters a battle. When this Pokémon enters battle, it changes the terrain to misty terrain.

Turns the ground into Grassy Terrain when
the Pokémon enters a battle. When this Pokémon enters battle, it changes the terrain to grassy terrain.

Prevents other Pokémon’s moves or Abilities from
lowering the Pokémon’s stats. This Pokémon's stats cannot be lowered by other Pokémon's moves or abilities.  This effect only applies to normal stat modifications and not more exotic effects such as topsy turvy or power swap.

This Ability is not bypassed by mold breaker, teravolt, or turboblaze.

Reduces the amount of damage the Pokémon takes
while its HP is full. When this Pokémon has full HP, regular damage (not fixed damage!) from moves is halved.

This ability cannot be nullified.

Reduces the power of supereffective attacks taken. Super-effective damage this Pokémon takes is reduced to 0.75×.

This Ability is not bypassed by mold breaker, teravolt, or turboblaze.
Powers up moves that are super effective. Increases super-effective damage dealt to 1.25×.

Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat when the Pokémon
enters a battle. Boosts the Pokémon’s Attack stat the first time the Pokémon enters a battle.

Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat when the Pokémon
enters a battle. Boosts the Pokémon’s Defense stat the first time the Pokémon enters a battle.

Changes the Pokémon’s type to the type of the
move it’s about to use. Changes the Pokémon’s type to the type of the move it’s about to use. This works only once each time the Pokémon enters battle.

If the Pokémon is not holding an item, it will fetch
the Poké Ball from the first failed throw
of the battle. At any time after the first Poké Ball is thrown and fails to catch a Pokémon, at the end of a turn, if a Pokémon with Ball Fetch is on the field and not holding another item, it will pick up the same type of ball as the first one thrown.

When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters

all Pokémon except itself. When the Pokémon is hit by an attack, it scatters cotton fluff around and lowers the Speed stats of all Pokémon except itself.

Ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon’s Abilities and

Ripens Berries and doubles their effect. Ripens Berries and doubles their effect.

Just being next to the Pokémon powers up moves.  "The power of moves used by the allies of the Pokémon with Power Spot is increased by 30%."
Changes the Pokémon’s type depending on the terrain. Changes the Pokémon’s type depending on the terrain.

When the Pokémon enters a battle, the effects of

When hit by a move that makes direct contact,

The Pokémon exchanges Abilities with a Pokémon

Protects the Pokémon and its ally Pokémon from

each turn. The Pokémon changes its form, alternating between its Full Belly Mode and Hangry Mode after the end of every turn.
Enables the Pokémon to move first occasionally. If a Pokémon with this Ability selects a damaging move, it has a 30% chance of going first in its priority bracket.
